contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Province Spain | name = Jaén | native_name = | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_flag = Bandera provincia Jaén contorno hispanofrancés.svg | image_shield = Escudo de la provincia de Jaén.svg | motto = | anthem = | image_map =Jaen in Spain.svg | latd = 38|latm = 00|latNS = N | longd = 3|longm = 30|longEW = W | coordinates_type = region:ES_type:adm2nd_source:GNS-enwiki | autonomous_community = [[Andalusia]] | capital = [[Jaén, Spain|Jaén]] | government_type = | president = Moisés Muñoz Pascual | president_party = [[Spanish Socialist Workers' Party|PSOE]] | area_total_km2 = 13484 | area_rank = 14th | area_percent = | elevation_m = | language = [[Spanish language|Spanish]] | population_total = 666190 | population_as_of = 2003 | population_rank = 23rd | population_demonym = | population_percent = | website = [http://www.dipujaen.com dipujaen.com] }} '''Jaén''' ({{IPA-es|xaˈen|pron}}) is a [[provinces of Spain|province]] of southern [[Spain]], in the eastern part of the [[Autonomous communities of Spain|autonomous community]] of [[Andalusia]]. It is bordered by the provinces of [[Ciudad Real (province)|Ciudad Real]], [[Albacete (province)|Albacete]], [[Granada (province)|Granada]] and [[Córdoba Province, Spain|Córdoba]]. Its capital is [[Jaén, Spain|Jaén]] city. Its area is [[1 E10 m²|13,484 km²]]. Its population is 657,387 (2003), of whom just about one-sixth live in the capital. It contains [[List of municipalities in Jaén|97 municipalities]]. One of the lesser known provinces of Spain compared to the heavily tourist-oriented coast, it has four national parks (one the size of the entire region of [[La Rioja (autonomous community)|La Rioja]]), and many other protected natural areas. The province also contains two [[Renaissance]] cities, [[Úbeda]] and [[Baeza]], both recently declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. The annual [[Linares chess tournament|chess tournament]] held in [[Linares, Spain|Linares]] attracts many of the world's best players. Jaén is one of the larger producers of [[olive oil]] in the world. It produces around 60% of all Spanish production. == See also == * [[List of municipalities in Jaén]] == External links == * {{es icon}}[http://www.juntadeandalucia.es/medioambiente/servtc5/ventana/mostrarFicha.do?idEspacio=7421 Despeñaperros Natural Park] * {{es icon}}[http://www.juntadeandalucia.es/medioambiente/servtc5/ventana/mostrarFicha.do?idEspacio=7422 Sierra de Andújar Natural Park] * {{es icon}}[http://www.juntadeandalucia.es/medioambiente/servtc5/ventana/mostrarFicha.do?idEspacio=7424 Sierra Mágina Natural Park] * {{es icon}}[http://www.juntadeandalucia.es/medioambiente/servtc5/ventana/mostrarFicha.do?idEspacio=7423 Sierras de Cazorla, Segura y Las Villas Natural Park] *{{es icon}}[http://www.turismoencazorla.com Cazorla, Segura y Las Villas] *{{en icon}}[http://www.castillodelairuela.es/english.html Photo album from La Iruela Castle - Jaén - Andalusia] {{Jaen}} {{Andalusian provinces}} {{Provinces of Spain}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jaen, Province of}} [[Category:Province of Jaén (Spain)| ]] {{andalusia-geo-stub}}
